questions.question_text:
One of the datastores containing a linked clone desktop pool is running out of disk space and an administrator adds a second datastore.
Which operation should the administrator perform to resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
D- Rebalance - A rebalance operation evenly redistributes linked-clone virtual machines among available datastores 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.0/com.vmware.horizon-view.administration.doc/GUID-1258E651-0A9F-4A71-AD59-F3CD57072E41.html

Selected Answer: D
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.13/horizon-virtual-desktops/GUID-FDFB3555-72FD-44E5-AE6D-38553A3A6B72.html

Selected Answer: D
For Linked Clones: Answer is D
For Manual Desktops: Answer is B

https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/57368

https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/57368 
Linked-Clone Desktop Pool == Rebalance / Manual-Desktop Pool ==== Storage vMotion
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/57368

This question is also on the exam:
One of the datastores containing a manual desktop pool is running out of disk space and an administrator adds a second datastore.
Which operation should the administrator perform to resolve the issue?
Please change the answer to D

Correct answer is D
A rebalance operation evenly redistributes linked-clone virtual machines among available datastores.
Correct Answer: D
agree with jerry

questions.question_text: Within User Environment Manager, which is the correct option to Turn Off the FlexEngine Config File Processing at logon and logoff for a particular application or setting?

choices.B: Disable the DirectFlex "" advanced settings within the VMware UEM GPO
choices.A: Uncheck the Enable DirectFlex for this config file option in the DirectFlex settings tab
choices.C: Disable by right-clicking the application or setting in the tree view
choices.D: Uncheck the Process during logon and logoff option in the Advanced settings tab

comments.content:
Correct Its D 
In the Advanced tab, you can configure file processing, skipping large or old files, and OS-specific settings.

FlexEngine usually processes all configuration files in the General folder that the user has NTFS read access to at logon and logoff. To change this, turn off the Process during logon and logoff option. Use this option to disable processing of a Flex configuration file. The option is also automatically turned off if you enable DirectFlex or configure App-V 4.x integration for a Flex configuration file.

discussion.content: D is correct. Reference: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Dynamic-Environment-Manager/9.2/com.vmware.user.environment.manager-adminguide/GUID-FBE29188-09DC-42C0-9063-D0830188BB24.html
D is correct: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Dynamic-Environment-Manager/9.8/com.vmware.user.environment.manager-adminguide/GUID-FBE29188-09DC-42C0-9063-D0830188BB24.html

In the Advanced tab, you can configure file processing, skipping large or old files, and OS-specific settings.

FlexEngine usually processes all configuration files in the General folder that the user has NTFS read access to at logon and logoff. To change this, turn off the Process during logon and logoff option. Use this option to disable processing of a Flex configuration file. The option is also automatically turned off if you enable DirectFlex or configure App-V 4.x integration for a Flex configuration file.

right answer is A: ''DirectFlex Settings for Google Chrome
The first option is to simply disable DirectFlex for Chrome by deselecting the check box in the User Environment Manager console after application profiling is complete. Note the prompt to answer Enable config processing during logon and logoff? when DirectFlex is disabled.''
https://blogs.vmware.com/euc/2017/04/vmware-user-environment-manager-application-profiler-exclusions-part-3.html

This is B
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2145286

questions.question_text: When integrating a Citrix deployment in VMware Identity Manager, what can be done in the Administration Console with Citrix resources?

choices.A: Entitle users to those Citrix resources
choices.B: View the Citrix resources and their entitlements
choices.C: Modify the settings of the Citrix resources
choices.D: Manage Citrix-published applications and Citrix-published desktops

discussion.content: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-Access/19.03/com.vmware.wsp-resource/GUID-F51D18A8-0F8E-4580-86C2-9A2C639E866F.html

comments.content: B maybe B & C if it was multiple choice

discussion.content:
B and C ??
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Identity-Manager/19.03/com.vmware.wsp-resource/GUID-F51D18A8-0F8E-4580-86C2-9A2C639E866F.html
After you integrate the Citrix server farms, you can view the synced resources and entitlements in the VMware Identity Manager console. You can also edit ICA session settings, such as the settings that control resolution or compression. You can configure the settings globally for all the Citrix resources in the VMware Identity Manager catalog, or for individual Citrix resources.

comments.content: You can also edit ICA session settings, such as the settings that control resolution or compression. You can configure the settings globally for all the Citrix resources in the VMware Identity Manager catalog, or for individual Citrix resources

discussion.content: After you integrate the Citrix server farms, you can view the synced resources and entitlements in the VMware Identity Manager console
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Identity-Manager/19.03/com.vmware.wsp-resource/GUID-F51D18A8-0F8E-4580-86C2-9A2C639E866F.html

choices.D: Microsoft Windows 2003 functional level or later
choices.A: Microsoft Windows 2008 functional level or later
choices.B: Microsoft Windows 2000 functional level or later
choices.C: Microsoft Windows 2012 functional level or later

discussion.content:
The actual correct answer is D.
See link: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-App-Volumes/2.18/com.vmware.appvolumes.install.doc/GUID-30A51CC0-4BB6-486E-9702-110DBC5BCD9C.html

Correct Answer is D

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-App-Volumes/2.18/com.vmware.appvolumes.install.doc/GUID-30A51CC0-4BB6-486E-9702-110DBC5BCD9C.html

questions.question_text: What is the minimum Active Directory functional level supported by App Volumes 2.x?

choices.B: Disconnect workstation, Reconnect workstation, Lock session, and Unlock session
choices.D: Restart workstation, Shutdown workstation, Disconnect session, and Reconnect session
choices.A: Lock workstation, Unlock workstation, Disconnect session, and Reconnect session
choices.C: Lock workstation, Unlock workstation, Logoff User, and Login User

questions.question_text: Within VMware User Environment Manager management console, which are correct Triggers for Triggered Tasks?

discussion.content: actual url https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Dynamic-Environment-Manager/9.9/com.vmware.dynamic.environment.manager-adminguide/GUID-14F8DB16-7C26-4A76-9FD2-C437C6EA72E2.html

A correct

Trigger Select the event that is used to trigger this task.
Workstation locked
Workstation unlocked
Session disconnected
Session reconnected
All AppStacks attached
Once App Volumes attaches all AppStacks, it initiates the All AppStacks attached event. This event is useful when VMware Dynamic Environment Manager performs actions during logon with conditions that rely on an AppStack not yet attached.
